Bozzuto's Inc.

400 Frontage Rd

North Haven, CT 06473



REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED / QUANTITY



Anhydrous Ammonia

22,600 lbs.



INTRODUCTION

Bozzuto's Inc is a wholesale food distributor based in central Connecticut for over fifty years. In September of

2008 Bozzuto's moved into an existing refrigerated warehouse distribution center. Among its advantages, this

distribution center utilizes the benefits of ammonia as a refrigerant. Bozzuto's does recognize ammonia as a

potentially hazardous chemical, and this was a consideration when selecting the facility. In consideration of the

risks associated with the use of ammonia, Bozzuto's commits its efforts to ensuring the employees and

surrounding community continue to enjoy a healthy and safe environment.

Part of this commitment includes:

- Employing only skilled refrigeration technicians;

- Contracting with only experienced ammonia refrigeration contractors;

- Organizing an in-house Emergency Response Team;

- Coordination with the North Haven Fire Department;

- Partnering with a hazardous materials release contractor; and

- Maintaining communication with the designated North Haven Local Emergency Planning Commission.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION

Accidental release prevention is the approach Bozzuto's has taken to minimize and possibly eliminate the

potential for an accidental release. Bozzuto's exercises ongoing preventive maintenance and equipment

integrity procedures.

Some of these programs include:

- Process Safety Management / Risk Management

- Hazard Communication, and

- Lockout / Tagout



EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

Bozzuto's maintains a twenty-four hour a day, seven day a week coverage of trained Security Officers. If an

emergency were to arise, the notifier will dial an emergency extension and be connected to a Security Officer.

The Security Officer will gather the information and initiate the Emergency Response Plan.

Having this continuous coverage reduces the response time in

an emergency condition, thereby minimizing the

consequences.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM

Bozzuto's views the risk of accidental release very seriously. Accidental release prevention programs include:

- Process Safety Management / Risk Management,

- Hazard Communication,

- Lockout / Tagout, and

- Risk Management.

Through a Process Hazard Analysis Study, Bozzuto's uses a hazard and operability study to identify potential

accidental release conditions. Solutions are then developed to prevent or limit these conditions from

happening.

If an incident were to happen, an investigation would take place, and new procedures would be implemented so

a similar occurrence could be prevented.

All Bozzuto's prevention programs are audited at regular intervals to validate their effectiveness; the objective is

to be proactive in preventing accidental releases, not reactive.



FIVE YEAR HISTORY

EPA's RMP Regulation defines "Accident" as the following:

"The release must be from a covered process and involve a regulated substance held above its threshold

quantity in the process."

The release must have caused at least one of the following:

On-site deaths, injuries, or significant property damage (?68.42(a)); or

Known offsite deaths, injuries, property damage, environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place

(?68.42(a))."

Based on the above definition and an investigation into the facility's accident history conducted during the

Process Hazard Analysis study on March 27, 2018, there have been no releases of ammonia that meet this

criteria in the past five years (March 2013 - March 2018). In addition, there have been no injuries resulting from

an ammonia release, nor any releases or "near misses" that warranted an internal incident investigation.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN

Bozzuto's Emergency Response Plan is organized in multiple levels of response, many of which are by trained

Bozzuto's employees. The Emergency Response Team is the core of

the response plan. This team is trained in

the Emergency Response Plan procedures and implementation. The Emergency Response Team meets to

review procedures and discuss new and improved methods of response. Among the benefits of having a trained

in-house response team are reduced response time and more immediate decision making capabilities; these

qualities greatly contribute to minimizing the effects in the event of an actual emergency.

The North Haven Fire Department is an important part of Bozzuto's Emergency Response Plan, and are kept

current with Bozzuto's facility information.

Bozzuto's continues to revise and improve its Emergency Response Plan. This effort is part of Bozzuto's

commitment to the health and safety of its employees and community.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Bozzuto's is continually looking for new ways of improving the safety level of its employees and community.

Bozzuto's continues to work with an experienced hazardous materials spill contractor. The intention of the

partnership is to provide Bozzuto's additional specific expertise in the field of hazardous materials release

procedures and prevention. Continuing discussions and exercises are planned to ensure an efficient and prompt

response time.

Bozzuto's plans to continue its efforts and commitment to health and safety.
